# Analysis of Discord Chat in "âš¡â”‚general"

## 1. Summary
The chat segment is very brief, containing only three messages discussing animation sources for VRM (Virtual Reality Model) format. A user named Cayden0207 asks about alternatives to Mixamo for VRM animations, mentioning they purchased ActorCore animations that didn't work. In response, mrtzhckr suggests Saymotion by DeepMotion as a potential alternative, sharing a link and asking if anyone has experience with it. Another user, ğ•½ğ–”ğ–šğ–˜ğ–™ğ–†ğ–“, expresses interest in the suggested tool but doesn't provide additional information.

## 2. FAQ
Q: Besides Mixamo, what are other sources of animation for VRM? (asked by Cayden0207) A: Saymotion by DeepMotion might be an option (answered by mrtzhckr)
Q: Has anyone had experience with Saymotion? (asked by mrtzhckr) A: Unanswered

## 3. Help Interactions
Helper: mrtzhckr | Helpee: Cayden0207 | Context: Seeking VRM animation sources after ActorCore purchase didn't work | Resolution: Suggested Saymotion as an alternative with link to the resource

## 4. Action Items
Feature: Investigate compatibility of Saymotion with VRM format | Description: Test if Saymotion can provide working animations for VRM models | Mentioned By: mrtzhckr

The chat contains a very brief exchange about manual sorting of objects in the outliner feature coming to Blender 5. Valiant mentioned this upcoming feature, and Pete responded with enthusiasm, suggesting this has been a long-awaited feature in the Blender community. No technical discussions, problem-solving, or implementations were shared in this limited exchange.
